Class Dungeon

java.lang.Object
fr.uge.backpackhero.donjon.Dungeon
public class Dungeon extends Object
Represents the entire Dungeon structure. Manages the list of floors and the player's progression through them.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Dungeon(List<Floor> floors)
    Constructs a Dungeon object.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Floor
    getCurrentFloor()
    Retrieves the floor the hero is currently on.
    int
    getFloorNumber()
    Returns the one-based number of the current floor (e.g., 1, 2, 3).
    boolean
    isFinished()
    Checks if the player has finished the dungeon (i.e., reached the exit of the last floor).
    boolean
    moveToNextFloor()
    Moves the player to the next floor in the sequence.

    Methods inherited from class Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Dungeon

      public Dungeon(List<Floor> floors)
      Constructs a Dungeon object. Initializes the floor list and sets the starting floor index to 0.
      Parameters:
      floors - The list of floors that make up the dungeon.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the floors list is null.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentFloor

      public Floor getCurrentFloor()
      Retrieves the floor the hero is currently on.
      Returns:
      The current Floor object.

    • moveToNextFloor

      public boolean moveToNextFloor()
      Moves the player to the next floor in the sequence.
      Returns:
      true if the transition to the next floor was successful, false if the current floor was the last floor.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks if the player has finished the dungeon (i.e., reached the exit of the last floor).
      Returns:
      true if the player is currently on the final floor index, false otherwise.

    • getFloorNumber

      public int getFloorNumber()
      Returns the one-based number of the current floor (e.g., 1, 2, 3).
      Returns:
      The current floor number.
